channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As Tokyo embraces a 4-day workweek to fight ‘death by overwork,’ Japan’s new prime minister just called a 3 a.m. meeting
item.description: The Japanese leader only sleeps two to four hours a night—and has personally pledged to ditch work-life balance in favor of “work, work, work.”

item.title: What 60 Minutes Got Wrong About Harvard and the Biomedical Research Enterprise
item.description: A recent segment was a sad attempt to cloak the shortcomings of academic science in hype, sentimentality, and public relations theater.

item.title: Trump’s Overdue Tariff Rollback
item.description: It would behoove the administration to apply the logic of the latest relief more broadly.

item.title: Companies and countries can stay nimble even as they navigate the ‘unexploded ordinance’ of U.S.-China competition, experts say
item.description: There's “incredibly high stakes" on the geopolitical front, foreign policy expert James Crabtree said during the Fortune Innovation Forum.

item.title: Supreme Court agrees to review Trump admin effort to limit immigrant asylum processing claims at border

item.title: Tennessee Teacher Who Mocked Charlie Kirk’s Assassination Got Her Job Back
item.description: Emily Orbison was reinstated on Nov. 11. She will receive back pay dating to Sept. 15, according to a district reinstatement letter.

item.title: Trump Is Right. Senate Republicans Should End The Filibuster Before It’s Too Late
item.description: The filibuster will end sooner or later, so conservatives should act now while they have power in the House, Senate, and White House.

item.title: In Defense Of The Penny (Because Nobody Would Pay A Nickel For These Thoughts)
item.description: The penny’s detractors nickel and dime us to death with their arguments for efficiency over and against tradition.

item.description: A misapplication of the First Amendment has led to an injustice.

item.title: Women Need Good Men
item.description: Love is the antidote to our poisonous culture of abortion.

item.title: Meet the dads choosing caring for kids over careers: ‘Men are starting to realize that missing crucial morning time and bedtime adds up’
item.description: Not a single stay-at-home father that Fortune spoke to had any regrets about swapping sending emails for changing diapers.

item.title: If Trump Has The Power To Ban Trade, Then He Has The Power To Moderate It Through Tariffs
item.description: Legal precedent, diplomatic equilibrium, and economic logic point in this same direction — the president can impose tariffs under IEEPA.
